item.title: Makin' wavs
item.description: I've been gearing up to do some audio programming and more generally learn about digital signal processing. As a first exercise, I decided to revisit a simple program I wrote while trying out rust a few years ago. I blogged about that here. There is, of course, a lot of Rust specific information in that post, but if you'd like background on the .wav format it is specified

item.title: Zig translate-c and linking equal best friends
item.description:
We have a weekly one hour interest group for Zig programming going at Recurse this batch. It's called the Zig Zone, which is both descriptive and alliterative. This is a pattern, other examples on my calendar include:

  • Rust Rodeo
  • OCaml Oasis
  • Clojure Conclave
  • Shader Shindig
  • Haskell Hangout
  • Django Discovery

Anyway you get the idea.

We all just show up wit...

item.title: An Unnamed Static Site Generator
item.description:
I wrote a static site generator; to dispense with the "why."

This blog has been, in order, wordpress, middleman, jekyll, and hugo. Each time I become comfortable with one, inevitably they will become too slow for my needs (jekyll) or introduce subtle, minute breaking changes into some version or another, offering me an opportunity to jump ship (middleman and hugo) or just be not fit for purpose / total overkill (wordpress). I ...
